channel.title: Where should I start?
channel.description: I'm taking high school AP Computer Science classes, and I want to put my programming skills to use. A long time ago I made a small local server, and I'm interested in making one again. I'm looking for the most reliable/complete code to start with for my server. What would you recommend? (I want the style of the server similar to soulsplit)

item.title: Where should I start?
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

well i suggest that you dont request 525+ graphics and stuff on this forums because u will find yourself at the bottom of the list…

Just google 525 rsps. You should be able to find something.

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I start?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

sk8rdude461:

I already understand java very well. But I want a source that’s near 100% done for me.

Lold

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I start?
item.dc:creator: @99milfs 99milfs
item.description:
@99milfs wrote:

alright… I just want to know what the best source / project is in your opinion. I’m looking for something like 525+

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I start?
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:10, topic:472346”][quote author=99milfs link=topic=590092.msg4177891#msg4177891 date=1355185957]
Well… I want a near complete server so I can focus on customizing it rather than fixing it. For example I plan on implementing an item upgrade system which would require a working base…

And is Lumbridge (http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,486895.0.html) a decent hyperion source?
[/quote]
I’m starting to question you knowledge since your trying to give you an already done source and your username is ‘99milfs’.[/quote]

i’m beginning to question if you have any sense of knowledge on how to fucking spell. anyways he didnt know it had a decent bit of content, he was merely asking.

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I start?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:472346”][quote author=99milfs link=topic=590092.msg4177882#msg4177882 date=1355185500]

I’m taking high school AP Computer Science classes, and I want to put my programming skills to use. A long time ago I made a small local server, and I’m interested in making one again. I’m looking for the most reliable/complete code to start with for my server. What would you recommend? (I want the style of the server similar to soulsplit)

You should start with a close to blank server. If everything has been added for you, what’s to learn?

Well… I already understand java very well, so I would learn best by looking at code…
[/quote]
I already understand java very well. But I want a source that’s near 100% done for me.[/quote]
This ^

If you start blank you can write all the methods yourself instead of studying a shitty PI soul split release.

Read full topic
